channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chipotle CEO sounds alarm on the American economy: Gen Z and millennials are too burdened by unemployment and student loans to eat out
item.description: “We're not losing them to the competition. We're losing them to grocery and food at home,” Scott Boatwright said.

item.title: Trump surgeon general nominee confirmation hearing postponed as she goes into labor
item.description: Trump surgeon general nominee Dr. Casey Means' confirmation hearing postponed as wellness influencer and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. ally enters labor.

item.title: The uncomfortable secret of successful people: Forget work-life balance, you have to be ‘obsessed’, ex-Wall Streeter and business coach says
item.description: “Obsession means that you’re thinking nonstop until your relentless action makes it unreasonable for you to not win,” she says.

item.title: Why It’s Impossible For Public Schools To Be ‘Neutral’ About Politics And Religion
item.description: By their definition and history, public schools are conservative government institutions and the only 'ideology' currently aligned with that purpose i...

item.title: A Time for Choosing on Antisemitism
item.description: Tucker Carlson’s friendly interview with Nick Fuentes makes it impossible to ignore the right’s festering antisemitism problem.

item.title: Vance tells Republicans to stop fearing federal power, says Democrats pioneered weaponizing it
item.description: Vice President JD Vance told a Turning Point USA crowd that Republicans shouldn’t fear using federal power, arguing the left has done so for decades.

item.title: Lawmakers race to stop 'next fentanyl crisis' with crackdown on nitazenes synthetic opioids

item.title: These tiny ‘bat bots’ can see in the dark, fly through smoke, and might save your life one day
item.description: “Bats are amazing,” Nitin Sanket, assistant professor of robotics engineering said. “We are nowhere close to what nature has achieved."

item.title: Erika Kirk’s act of forgiveness inspired Tim Allen to forgive the drunk driver who killed his father. But experts warn it’s complicated
item.description: Erika Kirk's public declaration inspired other high profile acts of forgiveness, including a church that forgave the gunman that killed four members o...

item.title: Woman Coerced Into Abortion Asks FDA To Stop Shielding Abusers And Their Drug Dealers
item.description: Markezich was 'so happy' when she became pregnant. Now, after her coerced abortion, the thought of her lost baby 'never really goes away.'

item.title: Dems Ignore Bureaucrats’ Pleas To End Shutdown After Pretending To Care About Govt Workers
item.description: The most electorally vulnerable House Democrats turn their backs on the largest federal employee union and its call for a clean CR.

item.title: China’s ‘Fortress Without Isolation’
item.description: Beijing’s latest Five-Year Plan, while couched in familiar bureaucratic language, marks a significant evolution in the regime’s grand strategy.

item.title: The Big Nothing

item.title: No, Gambling Isn’t Ruining Sports
item.description: Having betting out in the open is uncovering the wrongdoing that has likely been going on forever.
